utterance.speaker: MYRNA RAMSEY
utterance.content: Mr. McHugh. Mrs. McHugh. Your support has helped us make this a world class institution. We have such amazing plans for the new season. I’ll have Mr. Hayes tell you all about the exciting exhibits still available for sponsorship.

utterance.speaker: MYRNA
utterance.content: Where is he?

utterance.speaker: MYRNA
utterance.content: Go get him.

utterance.speaker: MYRNA
utterance.content: I’m sure Mr. Hayes will be here any second.

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: Myrna is freaking out, Owen. Where is Mr. Hayes?

utterance.speaker: OWEN
utterance.content: He’s not in the West Gallery. I’m about to look in the men’s room. Just keep looking for him.

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Darling.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: One second. I’m just about to toss a guy off the Brooklyn Bridge.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, I am sure that … Carter Damien would appreciate a short reprieve.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Too late. He just went kersplat. Now… how can I help you?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I’ve invited my acting class to come here Friday night to do the Nora scenes from A Doll’s House.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you for the warning, I will make myself scarce.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, no, no, darling. This class could really benefit from your perspective, as a, as a writer. No, you definitely should be here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: There’s a lovely girl in the class –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And I just thought maybe –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh Mother, you’re not trying to fix me up again. Haven’t you learned your lesson after the last fiasco?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Fiasco? You married her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, and how did that marriage end?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Honey, I am just trying to help you. You have to admit that your social life has been a bit anemic as of late.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And now I want to throw myself off the Brooklyn Bridge.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah, darling. All you have been doing for the last few months is writing and working with Beckett. Now, I think a fix up is in order. Unless …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You have some reason for not putting yourself out there.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Getting ready for your close up, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, just trying to discern the hidden meaning. Is it about the rise of technology, rampant narcissism, or did someone just have a lot of extra TVs?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, sometimes you don’t need to know what it’s about. Sometimes it’s just … art.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why Detective Beckett, how existential of you. Let me guess. Art theory in college?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. The closest I came to taking an art class was posing for one, as a model.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait .. .posing in…?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not a stitch.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Meet Brian Hayes. 39. Executive director of the museum.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like somebody gave him liberty and gave him death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea when this happened?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hayes was last seen at 10:00 by a Myrna Ramsey, museum’s development director. His body was discovered at 10:21, so the killer must have struck sometime within that window.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Killing him during the gala. That’s pretty ballsy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: My money’s on he walked in on the other crime being committed here tonight.

utterance.speaker: MYRNA
utterance.content: It’s called the Fist of Capitalism, a searing indictment of our consumer driven culture.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Somebody stole the Fist of Capitalism? Anyone check up the ass of socialism?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How much was it worth, Mrs. Ramsey?

utterance.speaker: MYRNA
utterance.content: Fifty million. The diamonds alone were worth thirty.

utterance.speaker: MYRNA
utterance.content: The Fist was on loan to us. Mr. Hayes assured the owners it would be safe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I noticed that you have cameras, so there’s obviously a security system. Why wasn’t the alarm triggered?

utterance.speaker: MYRNA
utterance.content: It should have been, the moment anyone stepped into this room. My security team is trying to determine why it wasn’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, we’ll need a list of all the people who attended the gala along with the videos from the cameras.

utterance.speaker: MYRNA
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ll also need to talk to whoever found the body.

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: I can’t believe this. This is the worst day of my life.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Were you close to Mr. Hayes, Alyssa?

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: We worked together. I helped him curate this exhibit. He was a lovely man and very supportive of young artists like me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, so you’re an artist?

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: This is my day job. Art is my passion. Mr. Hayes even put one of my sculptures in the exhibit.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did Mr. Hayes have any family?

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: A mother in .. Idaho, I think?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So … Mr. Hayes was supposed to work the crowd tonight, right? What do you think he was doing over here?

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: I know he was worried about the Fist of Capitalism. Especially with the gala, and the people, and all the distractions.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait. Are you saying he was worried someone might steal the Fist?

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: Ever since I got here. He even reviewed the security video of the Fist, going back two weeks to when we first put it on display. I thought he was being paranoid, but .. I guess he knew something I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fifty million dollars. That’s why Hayes was AWOL from the gala. He came to check on the Fist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But the thief was already on his way out with it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Through this gallery, which put him on a collision course with Hayes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Hayes confronts him, they struggle, and Hayes gets pushed into the spikes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And at that moment, our thief becomes a killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A killer who gains access to the museum through the gala.

utterance.speaker: SERENA KAYE
utterance.content: That’s not likely. All arriving guests were screened at two security checkpoints and then greeted by board members who knew them personally. Odds are, the thief came in through the roof. An air vent, probably, and then disabled the alarms.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, who are you?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: I’m Serena Kaye, the museum’s insurance investigator.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So if the thief got in through the vent, how did he get out?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: The loading bay. The guards there checked everyone entering, but they didn’t check people leaving. Plus, the bay was full of catering vans. He could have just had one waiting for him and just blended right in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, she’s good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: At theory. But what about proof?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: I don’t need proof to know that I’m right. It’s my job. And, I can help you with yours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: I get a 1% finders fee for recovering stolen objects. I want that Fist. You want your murderer. We have common goals. I could consult on your case and share my insight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, that is an intriguing idea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, thank you, that won’t be necessary.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Well, you can’t blame a girl for trying. Mr. Castle, Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, we really could have used her. She has valuable assets.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not those kind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, she’d just get in the way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really. And what if she’s on to something?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, check and see if all the catering vans are accounted for and interview all the catering staff. See if anyone saw anything unusual in the loading bay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now, was that so hard?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So for reasons unknown, Hayes thought someone might swipe the Fist of Capitalism. We don’t know why, but he goes to check on it and ends up paying for it with his life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, except as it turns out, that’s not what the security video shows.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What does it show?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The Fist, sitting there, undisturbed, in the gallery. The thief tapped into the camera lines and rigged a prerecorded loop. There’s no prints, but CSU did find what they think is hair gel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hair gel? Where would they find that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In the air duct.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In the air duct! That’s what Serena –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s a lucky guess.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So was the call on the loading bay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Two of the caterers recall seeing a blue Astro van parked there, the same color as the catering vans, but without the company logo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Imagine that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did we get a description on anyone in the van?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, but I put an APB out on it.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN GATES
utterance.content: Beckett!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh great, what did you do now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective, I believe you’ve met Serena Kaye.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Hello again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doin’ … here?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Ms. Kaye has presented me with a very compelling proposal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I am familiar with her proposal.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Difference is, I like what I heard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Captain Gates, I –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: She has expertise which she can bring to bear as a consultant on this case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I prefer working with my team.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Which includes a consultant with no expertise in anything? Serena will be a value add, for a change.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: I look forward to working with you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I will give you this, you’ve got some gigantic balls.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: What I said about the thief, did I turn out to be right?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: I’m about results, Detective. This is the best way for both of us to get what we want. Think of it as a merger.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: More like a hostile takeover. I’ll have Detective Ryan bring you up to speed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He bypassed security cameras here, and here. Then, near as we can figure, he left via the loading bay in a blue van.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And, uh, that’s … pretty much where we are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about the security footage that Hayes was looking at from two weeks ago? If the killer had cased out the exhibit, maybe he’s on that video.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm. Well, see, that - that’s the problem, because security downloads all the footage into flash drives and Hayes checked out one of the flash drives but now, it’s missing. It wasn’t in his office and it wasn’t on his body, either.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe the killer took it. Because he’s on it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: So what’s our next move?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Major case squad sent in a list of all of the fences that might be interested in a piece like the Fist, and so we are looking into that, now.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: The Fist is too hot to handle now that there’s a body on it, so the thief may try to fence off the diamonds, but he won’t do business with anyone on that list. Anyone on it is yesterday’s news.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, do you have a better idea?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, guys, I found something. I was going over security –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, Detective Esposito, this is Serena Kaye. She’s with us.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay. Anyhow, uh, we found these clamped to the wires on the security system. It basically cancels out the alarm signals before they reach the computer. It’s called an ISI or –

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: An inductive signal interrupter.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: It’s custom made. I recognize it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: From where?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: From a report I read. On the 1992 Vermeer theft in Brussels. The same thief used these to steal a dozen other paintings. These are his signature. I know who took the Fist. It’s Falco.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Falco what? Does he have a last name?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: No one knows. He’s never been caught. He’s never even been photographed. He’s a top art thief in Europe, though he hasn’t worked in years. Rumor was he’d gone out of the game.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, nothing like fifty million dollars to pull you out of retirement.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Now that we have some direction, I can get us some leads.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: You can’t come.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, you might have misunderstood the word ‘consultant’. This is my case.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: The people there won’t talk to cops. But they’ll talk to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … I’m not a cop either …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: … so …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s with us?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s get in touch with Interpol. I want to find out everything we can about Falco.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: You’re an interesting man, Mr. Castle. Crime fighter by day, mystery writer by night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re pretty interesting yourself. So, we meeting a secret informant?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Oh. I guess Beckett doesn’t just keep you around for your good looks.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: This place is as infamous as it is anonymous.

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: Serena. Why you been such a stranger? You don’t love me no more?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Ah, Finn. I’ve been busy.

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: Busy with what? Jason Bateman over here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, that got me out of a speeding ticket once.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Finn. This is time sensitive. We can play catch up later. Right now I need to know if anyone is moving D-flawless diamonds. A lot of them.

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: Time frame?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: They might have hit the market as early as last night.

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: These babies hot?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like a supernova.

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: Can’t help ya.

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: Well, you know, there was a guy. Who came my way a few days ago and … real cagey like. Tried to take my temp on a piece of art covered with a crapload of D-flawless d’s.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: Yeah. Some sort of marble hand or something.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: This guy. What’d he look like?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Serena was right. Falco’s a badass. Look how fat his Interpol file is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He boosted a Renoir from Pushkin in ’96 and a Monet in ’99, always using an ISI.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Doesn’t look like Falco’s killed anybody before.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: First time for everything, I guess.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, especially when Hayes stood between him and fifty million.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Though according to Interpol, Falco doesn’t steal for himself. He’s more of a gun for hire. Someone wants a Picasso? He boosts it for them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which gives us a second path to our killer. If we can’t find Falco, then we look for whoever hired him to steal the Fist.

utterance.speaker: JOY MCHUGH
utterance.content: I’ll tell you who hired him. Anton McHugh. My son of a b*itch husband.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: The Fist belongs to me and Anton. We loaned it to the museum from our collection.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would your husband steal it?

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: To screw me over.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right. But you said that he owns it.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: He owns half of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were going through a divorce.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: Oh, we keep up appearances. Mostly because neither of us will give up the Fifth Avenue apartment. But this? This time Anton has hit a new low.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then you’re fighting over the Fist?

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: I think it should stay in the museum. It’s a work of art. It should be enjoyed by the public.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right, but your husband’s not on board.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: There’s an understatement. At our last meeting with our divorce attorneys, he screamed at me that he would get the Fist back by any means necessary.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but saying that he wanted the Fist doesn’t mean that he necessarily hired someone to steal it.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: Yes, it does. Because he’s tried to steal it before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. McHugh, a curious incident happened two weeks ago when the Fist of Capitalism was on its way to the museum. Two men claiming to be from the moving company tried to intercept it.

utterance.speaker: ANTON MCHUGH
utterance.content: My understand is that was a bit of a mix up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now, there were no charges filed, but both men had long criminal histories.

utterance.speaker: ANTON
utterance.content: I had nothing to do with this. Never even so much as made contact with them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Interestingly, your divorce lawyer did. Made lots of phone calls to the men right before this mix up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s Falco?

utterance.speaker: ANTON
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: After your first failed attempt to steal the Fist you decided to hire a better class of thief. Unfortunately, he ended up killing Brian Hayes in the process.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which makes you an accessory to murder.

utterance.speaker: ANTON
utterance.content: What? You’re out of your mind. Wait a second. I bet Joy’s behind this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Trust me, Mr. McHugh, your divorce is going to be the least of your problems if you don’t tell us where Falco is.

utterance.speaker: ANTON
utterance.content: I’d never heard of any Falco and I didn’t take the Fist, all right? Truth is, I didn’t even want the damn thing. I just wanted Joy to think I wanted it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why is that?

utterance.speaker: ANTON
utterance.content: I thought if I made Joy think it meant something to me, she’d give me the vineyard in Napa.

utterance.speaker: ANTON
utterance.content: Now that it’s gone, that bag of botox is going to clean me out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So what do you think? You believe him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you know, either way we don’t have enough to subpoena McHugh’s financials to uh …

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Doesn’t look like Falco is working with McHugh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well who was he working with?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The museum’s director. Brian Hayes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our victim?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A man matching Hayes’ description met with Serena’s contact a few days ago asking about D-flawless diamonds.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So Hayes was in on the theft? He must have hired Falco to steal the Fist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, only Falco decided to keep it.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: So he murdered Hayes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Hayes was a coconspirator, that might lead us to Falco. Let’s take a look at his um, financials –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The usual.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: I’ll work on some of my other sources, see if we can get a line on him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh! Another jaunt into Manhattan’s seedy underbelly? Count me in.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Sorry. No need for Guy Friday on this one. I’ll just be making phone calls. Boring stuff. But I’ll catch you later?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Catch me any time.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Really? An insurance investigator.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A sexy insurance investigator. I think she’d make a great character for my next book.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well… you seem rather taken with her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I find her … impressive.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What’s she like?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s an uncooperative, cocky, stubborn, know it all.

utterance.speaker: DR CARTER BURKE
utterance.content: But she is good at her job?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, Castle seems to think so.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: And that bothers you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, of course it bothers me.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because he’s supposed to be …

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Be what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My partner! I mean, he’s supposed to be on my team. He’s not supposed to be all smitten.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Smitten? Mother, I think intrigued is a better word.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So, what’s our next move?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Move?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh Richard, honestly. Beckett has made it plain that she’s not available, for now. And now you’ve met this woman, she’s smart, she’s incredibly attractive, you’re intrigued by her … why not ask her out?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s … complicated.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Why is it complicated?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know why it’s complicated.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Only what you’ve told me. Kate. What are you really scared of? That he won’t wait for you? Or that he will?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. I figured that you were with Serena.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, she had a meeting with her bosses this morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so you already saw her this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, she texted me. Oh … you thought that we were …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I mean, you know, it’s pretty obvious that she really likes you, so…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It is?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So then, you think I should … pursue it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I mean, suit yourself.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. That uh, getaway van that the thief used? It was dumped in an alley in Queens.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any prints?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nope, wiped clean. Very professional. But CSU did find traces of that hair gel on the headrest. They’re trying to ID the manufacturer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett! Got that stuff on Hayes. All during the past year the guy shelled out some major cash to pay for his mother’s long term care bills. Financially the man was deep under water.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, probably thought the Fist was his only solution.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They also found some suspicious emails on his laptop, stuff about the museum’s security system. Tech traced them to an anonymous account.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Falco knows how to cover his tracks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: One of them mentions a meeting the day before the heist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So if we can figure out where they met, it might lead us to Falco’s identity.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m guessing it took place sometime between 12 and 2PM, since that’s the only time Hayes left the museum.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait a minute. I’ve got something on his phone records for that day. 11:06AM he made a 1 minute phone call to Escana’s restaurant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was making reservations. How much you want to bet it was for two? Him and Falco.

utterance.speaker: HOSTESS
utterance.content: Sure. I remember Mr. Hayes. Three days ago. They sat in a corner booth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he was here with someone?

utterance.speaker: HOSTESS
utterance.content: Definitely. The two of them were having a real intense conversation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you remember what this person looked like?

utterance.speaker: HOSTESS
utterance.content: Uh, she was tall, blonde, gorgeous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, Hayes was here with a woman?

utterance.speaker: HOSTESS
utterance.content: That’s right. She was in her 30s, but still really hot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Did she look like this.

utterance.speaker: HOSTESS
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s Serena.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s our thief.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, no, thank you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, just got off with the insurance agency. Guess what Serena did before she worked for them?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kindergarten teacher.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Art thief.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Alleged art thief.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whatever.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Suspected of pulling off some major jobs between ’01 and ’06. Prado, Uffizi, Houston, but they could never pin anything on her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, how the hell did she end up working insurance?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: About five years ago she went to the company and said she wanted to make good. Even told them where they were going wrong with their security.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me guess. She told them that they should all work together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, at least she’s consistent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And nostalgic. Looks like she’s up to her old tricks again.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Only now she’s added a new one. Murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s why she knew how the thief got into the museum. She was the thief.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And then she partnered up with us to steer us to the mythical Falco.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She played me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t worry, Castle. You’re not the only one.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: She’s in on it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh… we’re not exactly sure, sir, but the evidence suggests –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I want her in custody, Detective. Now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our case is circumstantial.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Get something concrete. I will not have this department publicly humiliated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So where is she now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At her hotel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She invited me for a drink.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did she? Doesn’t look like she’s in a rush to leave town.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, we press our one advantage. She doesn’t know we’re on to her. So we make a run on her without her finding out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How’re we going to do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Simple.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle asks her out on a date.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s what you wanted, isn’t it? All you have to do is keep her out of her room. And take her to the restaurant at the hotel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then, just show her a good time. And while you keep her occupied, we get into her room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what am I doing on this date? Am I supposed to trip her up? Get her to break?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, just stall her. Make some jokes. The important thing is to keep her out of her hotel room so we can search it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what do you say, Castle? Think you can charm her for an hour?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you serious?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Absolutely. I was going to give you one more day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then you were going to ask me out yourself.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Mmhmm. Well, I’m a woman who believes in going after what she wants.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can see that.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Besides, I didn’t really make it a secret that I was attracted to you, and I could tell you felt the same way about me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, looks like neither one of us is very good at keeping secrets.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nothing so far. You find anything?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hmm. You really want to nail this chick, don’t you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, it’s what we do, isn’t it? Catch bad guys?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but … seems like it might be about more than that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just keep looking, ‘kay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, why chose to be an insurance investigator? It’s really not something most little girls aspire to be when they grow up.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: It’s a … recent career change.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? What did you do before?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Actually, I was a thief.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Get out.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Well, that’s what the museums like to call me. I prefer to think of myself as an art retriever.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s the difference?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Well, the pieces I took had already been stolen from their rightful owners. Taken by Nazis, despots, governments. Just because a piece is in a museum doesn’t mean it belongs there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: I specialized in returning art to their rightful owners, starting with a small Rembrandt an SS officer took from my grandfather.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you were kind of like the female Indiana Jones, only without the hat and whip.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Well, without the hat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s getting hot in here.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: I have an idea. Why don’t we skip dessert?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh well, what’s the rush? I hear the strawberry shortcake here is excellent.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Wouldn’t you rather come up to my room for a drink?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The uh … strawberries are… supposed to be … really fresh.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Well, great. We can order them from room service. With extra whipped cream.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think I found something. It’s a message between Serena and a bunch of fences. Guess who’s trying to sell D-flawless diamonds.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I think I found something, too. The tools of the trade. As well as an ISI.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: There it is. The Skyline Suite.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: What? What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Arresting you for theft. And murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait. So now you’re telling me that you don’t believe she’s in on this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would she tell me she’s a thief? Why offer that up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because she’s feeding you just enough truths so that swallowing the lies is easier.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t think she’s behind this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, you’re thinking with the wrong body part.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was only a kiss. I was doing what you told me to – keeping her occupied. I was trying to give you enough time so that you could search her room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes! The room! The room where we found the suitcase and the email, which all stands as evidence against her right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just think we should give her a chance to explain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We? No, there is no way we’re going into the interrogation together.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Castle. But right now, based on this conversation and your behavior in the hotel, it is obvious that you have been compromised.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was just trying to do –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: – what you asked.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought I’d sit this one out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I gotta hand it to you. This whole long con you’ve got going? It’s impressive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cozying up to insurance agencies, telling them that you want to go straight, all the while waiting for your next score.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The only catch was that you knew you needed Hayes, but you knew you couldn’t get away with it if you let him live, so you insinuated yourself into my investigation to cover your tracks.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: And here I thought Rick was the only writer on your team.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Rick? Are you guys on a first name basis, now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, he was making out with her in the hotel hallway.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett told me to stall her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She also tell you to use tongue?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t need to spin stories. I’ve got you meeting Brian Hayes the day before the heist.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Yes, to go over security for the gala. He was concerned.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Concerned? He was involved.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: I didn’t know that it was all an act at the time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If that meeting was so innocent, then why didn’t you tell us about it before?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Because it’s not like I’m particularly proud of the fact that I didn’t figure out what he was up to. If I had, then the sculpture wouldn’t have been stolen and he might still be alive.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Man, she’s really selling the ‘thief with a heart of gold’ act.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe it’s not an act.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She is being really calm in there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, strangely calm. Maybe she didn’t do it. Either that, or she’s a psychopath , in which case, you sure can pick ‘em.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found the tools that you used to break into the museum: rope, grappling hook, lock picks.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: I specialize in recovery. The insurance agencies don’t care how I get the pieces back, just that I do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So basically you’re still a thief.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Recovery.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what part of recovery involves selling D-flawless diamonds on the black market?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Falco may try to move those stones. I was trying to flush out his possible fences. Listen, I’ve done my homework on you, Detective. I know that you’re a smart, methodical cop with great instincts. And those instincts are telling you right now that I’m innocent. For some reason, you’re ignoring them. Why is that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Kaye, your job Is recovery, as you call it. My job is to solve this homicide.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Then why don’t you put aside your personal agenda and ask me for my alibi so we can more on with this investigation. For the record, I was in a business meeting with my bosses when I got the call. If you want to check.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you’re telling the truth, then why have you been going behind our backs?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Because in my experience the police just get in the way. My job is to recover the sculpture, not play nice. But you’re right. I’ve been treating this like a regular case, and it’s not, so I promise, from here on out, no more secrets.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That won’t be necessary. We won’t be working together anymore.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Would it change your mind if I told you I know who Falco is?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: What you’re watching right now is security footage from the museum exhibit two weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You stole Hayes’ flash drive? That’s why it went missing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Remember, you’re trying to get us to trust you.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: At least I meant it when I kissed you. It wouldn’t have done you any good. You wouldn’t have known what to look for.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: See that guy right there? He’s casing the joint.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you tell?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Trust me, I can tell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you’re saying that’s –

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Falco.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well why didn’t you tell us this before?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: I just didn’t get a chance to show you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I guess you were busy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, okay. Perhaps we can just focus on getting this guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, how’s this supposed to help? We don’t even know his real name. Well, the only thing we can do is send photos to TSA and put out an APB. Otherwise, without more information it’s not going to do us any good.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What if I could tell you what hotel she was staying at? The gel in the vents and on the headrest of the van? CSU identified it as a proprietary formula made exclusively for the Wessex Hotel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s only one in the city.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s get the photos out to the hotel employees. If one of them recognizes him, we’ve got him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hello, Falco.

utterance.speaker: WILLIAM HOLT
utterance.content: Falco? I’ve got no idea what you’re talking about. My name is Holt. William Holt.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, William Holt. British passport, you just got into town two weeks ago. You also happened in Bilbao ten years ago when the Pissarro went missing. And then in Berlin fifteen years ago when that El Greco disappeared.

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: Don’t know anything about that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Drop the act, Falco. We’ve got a video of you casing the museum two weeks ago. That is you, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: Whenever I come into a new town I always take time out to admire the city’s treasures. Is that a crime?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no. But sneaking back in and stealing them is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look familiar? It was used to disarm the security systems in the museum. They also found matching ones in Bilbao and Berlin.

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: If you say so. I, for one, have never seen anything like that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The hotel that you’re staying at, it’s nice, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They even have their very own exclusive hair products.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hair products that left a trace in the air duct system. And by the way, uh, hair gel? Not very manly.

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: Hundreds of people are staying at my hotel. And I’m pretty sure you didn’t find prints on that so, what exactly were you planning to book me on?

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: This Falco person you’re chasing? Are you sure he’s your guy? From what I know about him, he’s no murderer. He might not be as involved as you think.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: He’s trying to tell us something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, to politely go to hell.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: No, he went out of his way to tell us he’s not the murderer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, most people do that in the room. CSU come back with anything from the hotel?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nothing. No equipment, no Fist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you thinking?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: He knows something. But he can’t tell us without admitting he was there. Let me talk to him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re kidding, right? He’s a suspect and you’re not even a cop.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: No, I’m a thief. Like him. He’ll talk to me.

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: Whoa. Bad cop struck out, good cop gets a turn?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: I’m not a cop.

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: Well then, who are you?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Mmm… that depends on who you ask. I’m Der Geist in Zurich, Pantera in Spain. Police Nationale know me as Gaston. But you … probably know me as Jackal.

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: The Prado? ’07? Are you saying that was you?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: How did you get by the sound sensors?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: I had the Russian build me a wave cancellation box. Heard he built one for you for the Boston job.

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: That’s no easy exit, Prado. How did you get the piece out?

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: Hmm. The guard was so busy checking out my assets that he didn’t notice me cut the trip wire on the Goya’s back. I came in later on the skyline and whipped it right out.

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: I’ll be damned.

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: But now you’re here, working with the cops. So you must have got caught.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Uh uh. I got smart. One day you realize that you, or someone else, is going to get hurt.

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: I didn’t kill him.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: But you were there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Think she’ll get him to talk?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who knows, Castle. Maybe she’ll kiss it out of him.

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: I wasn’t hired to steal the Fist. My contact told me I was being paid to test their security for vulnerabilities. I was to break in, disable the alarm, and walk out undetected all before 10PM. And for my trouble I got $200 grand in advance.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Who hired you?

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: Oh, church and state, love. Everything goes through a third party, you know that. Safer that way.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Mmm, yeah, until you get set up. The real thief needed you to disable the alarms.

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: Yeah, apparently.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: What’d you see?

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: Nothing at first. I mean, it all went too easy. I got halfway back to the loading bay when it hit me. I mean, I had already disabled the alarms, right? And it was just … sitting there.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: You went back for the Fist?

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: Well, there’s an awful lot of temptation, fifty mil. When I got back to the room there was a woman walking toward the Fist. So I got the bloody hell out of there.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: This woman. What did she look like?

utterance.speaker: HOLT
utterance.content: I barely got a glimpse. All I can say for sure is she was wearing a black dress.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: C’mon, Beckett. He’s got no reason to lie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s a thief. He’s got plenty of reasons to lie.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Not about this. He knows you’ve got nothing on him. All he’d have to do is wait and you’d have to release him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If Falco is telling the truth, and with Hayes’ money trouble, the $200 thousand payment to Falco rules him out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, why would he go to the bar asking about fencing diamonds?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Because he was paranoid someone was trying to steal the Fist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not paranoid. Right. Which means our killer is probably whoever Falco saw going into the room with the Fist.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: And when Hayes got in the way she spiked him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he say anything about what the woman looked like?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Just that she was wearing a black dress.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There were over 200 people at that gala and half of those women were wearing black.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: And more importantly, if she didn’t leave by the loading dock then how did she get the Fist out of the museum?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. How did she?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She waits for Falco to finish disabling the system and then she comes in through the gala.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And with the alarm system deactivated, she grabs the Fist. But Hayes is paranoid about security, so he comes in to check on the exhibit. He catches her and she’s forced to kill him.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Now she’s in a hurry to leave before someone discovers her with the Fist and the body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But she can’t take it out through the gala without being spotted.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And she can’t take it through the loading bay without one of the catering staff noticing her dressed in black.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Well, those are the only two exits. And both of those choices leave too much to chance. She would have easily gotten caught.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So she can’t take it through the gala and she can’t take it through the loading bay. How the hell did she get it out of here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe she didn’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What I mean is …

utterance.speaker: MYRNA
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It never left the museum.

utterance.speaker: MYRNA
utterance.content: Mr. Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like I broke this case wide open.

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: You needed to see me, Detective?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. We need to talk to you about your installation.

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: Oh my God, what happened?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a new interpretation I’m working on. I call it ‘busted’.

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: It’s ruined. Who the hell did this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: More to the point, who put the Fist in it?

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: The Fist was in it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That way the thief didn’t have to worry about smuggling it out. She just could simply rejoin the party.

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: She?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know that whoever stole the Fist was a woman wearing a black dress. The same woman that killed Mr. Hayes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If I remember correctly, you were wearing a black dress that night.

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: So was every woman in here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but only one of them knew that there was a compartment inside that piece nearby. It was a perfect plan … until Brian Hayes showed up and saw you.

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: It … it wasn’t me. I swear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean it wasn’t just you. You didn’t have the money to pay Falco, but you did use your position to place the piece in the exhibit.

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: I didn’t place anything. That piece was selected by the board, just like all the art in here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, and when the exhibit was done, it would come back to you, only worth about fifty million more.

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: No, it wasn’t coming back to me. I sold it last week. It was going to –

utterance.speaker: ALYSSA
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: I found Alyssa’s work compelling. I’m not sure why I’m having to justify my taste in art.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because this particular piece just happened to have a bronze Fist in it.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: You found my Fist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, right where you put it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, right about now is where you should be thinking about whether pushing Hayes was an accident or not. Because that’s going to make a 30 year difference in your prison sentence.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: You think I did that to Brian Hayes?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now we’ve obtained a warrant for your financials, and we will find evidence of the $200 thousand you paid William Holt, also known as Falco, to disable security at the museum.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: I’m sorry dear, you’ve lost me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: CSU found your fingerprints all over the Fist.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: Of course they did. It belongs to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bloody fingerprints. His blood. Your prints.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s over. You killed a man, Mrs. McHugh.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: You don’t understand. My husband was going to take it away. I just took what was rightfully mine. Brian Hayes just showed up out of nowhere. He saw me with the Fist in my hands. What was I supposed to do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what’s ironic? Your husband would have let you have the Fist. He didn’t even want it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The DA said that her husband called several times begging to testify against her.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: When can I collect the Fist? The insurance agency is asking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, well, it’s in evidence. Once the case is resolved, they’ll release it.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: I want to thank you. I couldn’t have done this without you. I’m really grateful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So does that mean that you’re cutting me in on the finder’s fee?

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: I’m not that grateful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I uh …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think we all ended up with what we wanted.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, you know, after you and Castle went on that date –

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: More like a sting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He never thought that you were involved. He believed in you, even when I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Why are you telling me this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It just … I think that you should know what kind of person you’re dealing with.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here we are, ladies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anything wrong?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no. I should, um … I’m just going to go and file some stuff.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: Uh, and I’m - I’m going to go back to my hotel.

utterance.speaker: SERENA
utterance.content: I would ask you to come but, it’s like I said. I don’t steal things that belong to someone else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys didn’t go out?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because I can’t afford it. The museum just slapped me with a bill for the exhibit I broke.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoa!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know! You’d think they’d cut me some slack after the whole ‘helping to solve the murder’ thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I guess the least the NYPD could do is take you out for a hamburger.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I accept.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I could put Alexis through college on this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, and med school.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank God I’m rich.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
